scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Russian emigre, socialist. Original MSS (largely in Russian), clippings, photographs. Following his expulsion from Russia for radical activities (1884) and immigration to U.S. (1891), Ingerman was associated with the Socialist Labor Party, and later helped found the Socialist Party of America. Chairman, Russian Immigrants Aid Committee. Writings include discussions of his opposition to Lenin and Trotsky, the failure of the social democratic party in Russia, Social Democratic Society of New York, Karl Kautsky, Raphael Abramovitch. Includes obituaries (in English, Russian, German, Yiddish) of wife, Anna Ingerman, M.D., who was also an active socialist.
